page.title: 02PADSTOW'S FISHING INDUSTRY
page.content: Padstow's fishing industry is enjoying a new lease of life after the general decline since the railway closed in 1967,in fact it is now the{3rd largest {fishing port in the S.W.}Two main reasons are a new{fuel supply tank} situated on the quayside,and an{ {ice-making machine}next to it, supplying the ice needed to keep newly caught fish fresh.Padstow has many local boats which rarely stay out of port for more than 36 hours,fishing for{mackerel,dog-fish,lobsters and {crabs.}Larger trawlers,for deep-sea fishing, are basing themselves in Padstow, though it will be some time before{the harbour will hold 138 {fishing boats again,}which one elderly resident recalls seeing as a young boy in the 1920's when a storm put a stop to all fishing at sea.
